author: ryanleeschneider
content:
First time seeing this:

```
Jul 15 00:23:40 ip-10-0-66-158 geth[11433]: WARN [07-15|00:23:40.760] Sidechain ghost-state attack detected    number=10,636,486 sideroot=ababd0..8dd056 canonroot=ababd0..8dd056
Jul 15 00:23:40 ip-10-0-66-158 geth[11433]: WARN [07-15|00:23:40.767] Synchronisation failed, dropping peer    peer=eb0bc54662f3a70bc24d286ea98265eb1818af66c77f59dfb7fcebee4902998e err="retrieved hash chain is invalid: sidechain ghost-state attack"
```

This is on one of our ropsten 1.10.4 nodes.  Anyone else seeing anything like that?  Anything we should be concerned about?  This is actually one of our old nodes I was about to decommission since I've spun up a replacement 1.10.5 node, but I'll leave it up until tomorrow in case there's any useful info I can collect.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: FWIW this was one of our test nodes that was getting restarted every couple hours, so rather than an actual ghost attack I'm figuring it just hit a corner case where the block was imported during shutdown but not fully processed, which then triggered the ghost alarm when the block as seen again on restart, but if anyone else happens to see anything similar on their ropsten nodes please mention it, I spot checked all our other nodes and am not seeing anything else like this.

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
Almost 100% this was a restart bug, as looking deeper into the logs it started emitting that warning right after the last restart.  

So, nevermind, thought maybe some interesting attack has happening on Ropsten! :). I'll still keep it around for the next 18h or so, @-me if someone wants me to debug something on it.
